means: 干城章嘉峰（喜马拉雅山东部的山脉）

PerfectNetExp.abs: kancheepuram 坎奇普兰, kanchenjunga 干城章嘉峰, kanchel 坎切尔

means.word_mean: 1. a mountain the Himalayas on the border between Nepal and Tibet (28,146 feet high)

auth_sentence.content: The Lepcha community, in the state of Sikkim, pray every year to the world's third highest mountain, Kanchenjunga.
auth_sentence.res_content: The Lepcha community, in the state of Sikkim, pray every year to the world's third highest mountain, Kanchenjunga.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The Lepcha community, in the state of Sikkim, pray every year to the world's third highest mountain, Kanchenjunga.

auth_sentence.content: Gerlinde Kaltenbrunner climbed 14 summits, of which Mount Everest, K2 and Kanchenjunga are the most famous.
auth_sentence.res_content: Gerlinde Kaltenbrunner climbed 14 summits, of which Mount Everest, K2 and Kanchenjunga are the most famous.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Gerlinde Kaltenbrunner climbed 14 summits, of which Mount Everest, K2 and Kanchenjunga are the most famous.

auth_sentence.content: In 1955, he became the first man to reach the summit of Kanchenjunga, the third highest mountain in the world.
auth_sentence.res_content: In 1955, he became the first man to reach the summit of Kanchenjunga, the third highest mountain in the world.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: In 1955, he became the first man to reach the summit of Kanchenjunga, the third highest mountain in the world.
